intro: Loeseneriella camerunica, commonly known as the Cameroon loeseneriella, is a flowering plant native to Cameroon. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
